sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The sind function is used to find the sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, sind (0) is 0.
sections.text_content: The sind function is used to find the sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, sind (0) is 0.
sections.mdown_content: The **sind** function is used to find the sine of an angle given in degrees. For example, **sind** (0) is 0.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 12
            const angle := i * 30
            put "Sin of ", angle, " is ", sind ( angle )
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the sine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the sine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the sine of 30, 60, 90, up to 360 degrees.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the cosd and tand functions for calculating cosine and tangent.

the sin function which finds the sine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the cosd and tand functions for calculating cosine and tangent.
the sin function which finds the sine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[cosd.html](cosd)** and **[tand.html](tand)** functions for calculating cosine and tangent.

the **[sin.html](sin)** function which finds the sine of an angle given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
